sub_title: Attorney-at-law specialising in international dispute resolution | Partner at Pogust Goodhead
summary:
I am an attorney in private practice specialising in international dispute resolution with a focus on class actions before local courts, corporate and commercial litigation as well as international commercial and investment arbitration.

Having lived and/or worked in Germany, Switzerland, the Netherlands and France, I consider myself a true European citizen. 

My experience includes acting as counsel in civil proceedings before local (Dutch and French) courts as well as in international and domestic arbitrations under the ICC, LCIA, ICSID, UNCITRAL and NAI rules, with a focus on energy (oil & gas), environmental, infrastructure, financial services, commercial and post M&A disputes. I also act as arbitrator in commercial arbitrations.

I advise private investors and States on investment protection and international investment arbitration, including on claims under the Energy Charter Treaty, as well as public international law issues.

Member of the ESG Arbitration Subcommittee of the International Bar Association (IBA), the International Arbitration Commission of the Association Internationale des Jeunes Avocats (AIJA), the Investment Arbitration Committee of the Dutch Arbitration Association (DAA), LCIA YIAG, ICC YAAF, ICDR Y&I and Young ICCA. 

I regularly speak, teach and publish on topics of international arbitration and have been included in the list of Who's Who Legal - Arbitration Future Leaders since 2019.
